topic.title: BACKGROUND INFORMATION ON MALARIA AND RTS,S

keymessage.title: What causes malaria?
Why do we need a malaria vaccine?
What is RTS,S?
How does RTS,S work?
What does the acronym ‘RTS,S’ stand for?
Will RTS,S cure malaria?
Will the emerging drug resistance to malaria drugs have also an effect on the efficacy of RTS,S, or vice versa?
What is the effect of RTS,S on different parasite strains?
Will RTS,S prevent or delay acquisition of natural immunity, resulting in an increased risk of malaria at older ages?
Can the RTS,S be used in the renewed effort to eliminate/eradicate malaria?
If anti-malaria drugs have greater efficacy in preventing malaria than that seen with the RTS,S vaccine candidate, why don’t we simply provide them to all children in sub-Saharan Africa?
What are the symptoms of clinical and severe malaria?
When did development of RTS,S begin?
What additional trials of RTS,S planned in the future?

subtopic.title: ETHICAL ASPECTS OF THE RTS,S MALARIA VACCINE CANDIDATE DEVELOPMENT

keymessage.title: Why is RTS,S being tested in African children?
How will the partners ensure that trials are conducted safely and ethically?
What is the informed consent process for the RTS,S clinical trials?
What will you do if a child seems to be getting sick during the trial?

subtopic.title: DESIGN OF THE LARGE PHASE III EFFICACY STUDY

keymessage.title: What is the design of the Phase III efficacy trial?
What was the dosing regimen employed in the Phase III trial?
What comparator vaccines were included in the Phase III trial?
Why did you start the study with children 5-17 months of age rather than in infants, who are the target population?
What other malaria control interventions were used in this Phase III trial?
Are you sure that your disease surveillance did not miss a lot of malaria cases?
What was the age distribution of the vaccinees in the Phase III trial?
Why do you use different case definitions e.g. for vaccine efficacy and cases averted?
What is the efficacy of RTS,S in infants 6-12 weeks old at first vaccine dose?
What is the efficacy of a fourth dose?
What is the efficacy of RTS,S in children 5-17 months old at the first vaccine dose?
Why was the efficacy lower in infants 6-12 weeks of age than in children 5-17 months of age?
Does the vaccine work equally well across the clinical trial sites (across diverse malaria transmission settings?)
Does the vaccine efficacy wane over time? How long does RTS,S protection last?
Did the protective efficacy wane more rapidly in infants 6-12 weeks of age?
Are the phase 2 results published by Olotu and Bejon in line with the phase III results?
With the decline in malaria, why invest in a malaria vaccine which has only moderate efficacy instead of in current malaria control interventions
What does partial or moderate efficacy mean in real terms?
What is the estimated public health impact of RTS,S in view of its moderate efficacy?
Why is RTS,S only partially or moderately efficacious?
What is the overall safety profile of RTS,S across the Phase II and Phase III programme?
What are the key safety results of the Phase III (Malaria-055) study?
Did RTS,S increase the risk for meningitis in the Phase III efficacy trial?
Were any deaths reported in this Phase III efficacy trial?
Does RTS,S change the pattern of severe malaria, and increase the risk of more severe forms of malaria like cerebral malaria?
Can RTS,S be co-administered with other childhood vaccines?
What data has been generated on RTS,S in HIV-infected children?
What is the estimated cost for RTS,S delivery?
What is the estimated cost-effectiveness of RTS,S?
What is the economic burden of malaria?
What is the economic impact of malaria prevention and control?
How much will the vaccine cost?
Will Gavi support implementation of RTS,S as for other vaccines?
How will you ensure that cost of the vaccine will not be a barrier to access?
What is the intellectual property on RTS,S?
How will you ensure that the vaccine, once approved, will reach those who need it?
Will RTS,S be made available as part of a tiered pricing structure?
How much will development of the vaccine cost and who is paying?
When will MosquirixTM be approved for use in Africa?
What data was included in the file submission to the European Medicines Agency?
What is the regulatory process?
For whom is MosquirixTM indicated?
Why should the international community start preparing now, if RTS,S will not be rolled out for several years  and there is no guaranteed funding for its purchase?
When will RTS,S be made available for implementation?
Will RTS,S be available outside of sub-Saharan Africa?
Will the implementation of the RTS,S malaria vaccine candidate in malaria endemic areas replace the current malaria control interventions?
Does GSK plan to make RTS,S eventually available as a travellers vaccine?
What will the product presentation of RTS,S be? What is the pack size?

topic.title: PARTNERS IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE RTS,S MALARIA VACCINE CANDIDATE

keymessage.title: Why is a partnership necessary to develop a malaria vaccine? Is it appropriate for a large pharmaceutical company like GSK to receive money from a non-profit organization for R&D?
Who is responsible for the development of RTS,S?
Does the use of adjuvants in the RTS,S malaria vaccine candidate increase the risks or side effects associated with the vaccine?
What is an Adjuvant? Why does GSK use an Adjuvant System in the RTS,S malaria vaccine candidate?
What is the composition of the AS01 adjuvant contained in the malaria vaccine candidate?
Why is GSK/MVI looking to develop another malaria vaccine if the RTS,S Phase III trial is not yet complete?
What is a ‘blood-stage’ malaria vaccine and how does this differ from RTS,S?
What are the FMP2.1/AS02 trial results that were published in 2011 in the NEJM, and how do they relate to the RTS,S malaria vaccine candidate?
Is GSK developing any other malaria vaccines? Who are you partnering with?
What is a 'prime boost' vaccine?
What is the study evaluating a delayed fractional dose of RTS,S?
What is the vaccine candidate ChAd63 ME-TRAP/MVA ME-TRAP and RTS,S/AS01
What is the malaria vaccine candidate Ad35.CS.01 x RTS,S and how is it different from RTS,S
Sanaria Inc. recently tested a whole-sporozoite approach in humans with very promising results and says that it could be available for use withing five years. Why don't we just wait for that?
How does the MSP3 malaria vaccine candidate reported in the September edition of the NEJM 2011 relate to the RTS.S malaria vaccine?
Is GSK developing any other treatments for malaria beyond vaccines?
